Add additional documents by capturing or uploading

To continue using the Bima Yangu app seamlessly, please ensure that all necessary permissions are enabled. You can easily manage these permissions by navigating to the app settings and ensuring that all required permissions are granted. By enabling all permissions, you will have access to the full functionality of the app.
I’ll need to check the front bumber
I have read and agree to the
Kindly scroll down to read the complete terms and conditions.
Please agree to our terms and conditions.
Please add a vehicle to continue!

Using this App, insured personnel can report motor insurance-related claims instantly and get a faster response. To use this App, you need an active Kenya phone and a valid Motor Insurance certificate.

The location is necessary for reporting the exact location of the accident/incident/claim. This function gets activated only when the application is in use and does not work in the background. The primary value is when the user captures images, the location and time, and the date gets stamped—this also aids in the quick arrival of emergency services.

The camera gets activated and accessed only when the application needs to add visual evidence at the time of vehicle registration and an accident. Images captured by the App are geo-tagged and time-stamped and, serve as visual evidence of the accident and can be compared with pictures of the vehicle before the incident. The camera is also accessed when the user does a video KYC to confirm details before the final submission.
The storage is local to the App and doesn\'t access the user\'s personal storage. Likewise, the App never accesses the user\'s other storage artifacts (ex: gallery/pictures).

The contacts are optional and for ease of adding emergency contacts using phone contacts. Instead of typing the details, the user can pick a person from the address book. However, all other contact details are not accessed or contacted in any way. The emergency contact information is encrypted and not visible to anyone else besides the customer or owner of the phone.

The phone call function is accessed only when the victim of the accident has to call emergency support services, e.g., ambulance, police, or Towing services. In such a scenario, the user is provided numbers and redirected to the dial pad to call and avail of the trauma care.
The microphone is used for recording the voice messages as part of the accident reporting only when the user explicitly clicks on the record function.
